abstract: Astronauts lose significant bone mass during lengthy space flights. NASA wishes to monitor this bone loss in order to develop nutritional and exercise countermeasures. Operational Technologies Corporation (OpTech) has developed a handheld device that quantifies bone loss in a spacecraft environment. The innovation works by adding fluorescent dyes and quenchers to aptamers to enable pushbutton, one-step bind-and-detect FRET assays that can be freeze-dried, rehydrated with body fluids, and used to quantify bone loss.
title: Handheld Fluorescence Resonance Energy Transfer (FRET)-Aptamer Sensor for Bone Markers

publications.publicationName: An Overview of SBIR Phase 2 Physical Sciences and Biomedical Technologies in Space

related.title: An Overview of SBIR Phase 2 Physical Sciences and Biomedical Technologies in Space
